description: By imposing tariffs on dozens of countries starting August 7, the world's largest economy has madea decisive shift toward protectionism. Elsewhere, trade is becoming increasingly regionalized.

France halts Gaza arrivals pending probe into student's antisemitic posts
description: The French foreign minister said France will suspend its programme to receive Palestinians from conflict-torn Gaza after the Sciences Po Lille university revoked a student's accreditation over the online posts.

headline: Brazil sees notable drop in homicide rate
description: The number of homicides has reached its lowest level since 2012. The result is attributed to public security initiatives introduced by President Lula's government, as well as a truce between the country's main gangs and the aging of Brazil's population.

headline: 'Dracula': Luc Besson's visual bloodbath filled with clichés and problematic female characters
description: The director, aiming for a sweeping romantic epic, instead delivers a film packed with clichés and visual excess.

headline: Contraceptives destroyed in silence: 'Can France accept to become the executor of a senseless policy imposed by the US?'
description: IUDs, implants, and birth control pills funded by USAID under the Biden administration are being incinerated on French soil. They were intended for reproductive health programs, particularly in Africa. Five leaders of non-governmental organizations (NGOs) condemn the move.

In the DRC, Chinese and American companies race for lithium
description: In the southeast of the Democratic Republic of Congo, the city of Manono sits atop the world's largest reserves of this mineral essential to the energy transition. A Chinese group signed the first contract there in 2022, followed this year by a California-based company.

headline: In Brazil, the free and instant mobile payment system Pix challenges US dominance
description: Launched by the Central Bank of Brazil, this system is now used more than credit cards and cash. Its popularity is so great that WhatsApp had to abandon a payment system it wanted to launch locally.

headline: Call boy and ex-heroin addict, Tom B: 'In West Berlin, everyone mixed and chose their scene'
description: 'Being 20 in West Berlin' (4/6). Tom B. came to West Berlin as a young gay man in the mid-1980s, became an escort and fell into drug addiction, just as AIDS began to strike. Now in his sixties, the sex worker and social worker has come a long way.
